stork.feather

Class PassiveTap

  • java.lang.Object
    • stork.feather.PipeElement
      • stork.feather.Tap
        • stork.feather.PassiveTap

  • public abstract class PassiveTap
extends Tap
    This is the base class for a passive Tap implementation.
    See Also:
    Sink, Slice

    • Method Detail

      • attach

        public final ProxyTransfer attach(Sink sink)
        Attach this tap to a sink. Once this method is called, PipeElement.start() will be called and the tap may begin emitting Slices.
        Overrides:
        attach in class Tap
        Parameters:
        sink - a Sink to attach.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if sink is null.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - is a sink has already been attached.

      • initialize

        protected final Bell<?> initialize(RelativeResource resource)
        Description copied from class: Tap
        Initialize the pipeline to transfer a Resource. Active Taps should call this to initialize downstream elements for transfer. Passive taps will have this called to signal that a transfer should begin.
        Specified by:
        initialize in class Tap
        Parameters:
        resource - the resource which should be initialized.
        Returns:
        A Bell which will ring when data for resource is ready to be drained, or null if data can begin being drained immediately.

      • drain

        protected final void drain(RelativeSlice slice)
        Description copied from class: PipeElement
        Drain a RelativeSlice through the pipeline. This method returns as soon as possible, with the actual I/O operation taking place asynchronously.
        Specified by:
        drain in class Tap
        Parameters:
        slice - a Slice being drained through the pipeline.

      • finalize

        protected final void finalize(RelativeResource resource)
        Description copied from class: PipeElement
        Finalize the transfer of data for the specified resource. This method should return immediately, and finalization should take place asynchronously.
        Overrides:
        finalize in class Tap
        Parameters:
        resource - the resource being finalized.

      • finalize

        protected final void finalize(RelativeException error)
        Description copied from class: PipeElement
        Finalize the transfer of data for the specified resource. This method should return immediately, and finalization should take place asynchronously.
        Overrides:
        finalize in class Tap
        Parameters:
        error - the resource being finalized.

      • random

        protected final boolean random()
        Description copied from class: PipeElement
        Check if the pipeline is capable of draining slices in arbitrary order. The return value of this method should remain constant across calls.
        Overrides:
        random in class Tap
        Returns:
        true if transmitting slices in arbitrary order is supported.

      • concurrency

        protected final int concurrency()
        Description copied from class: PipeElement
        Get the number of distinct resources the pipeline may be in the process of transferring simultaneously. Specifically, this value limits how many times #initialize(RelativeResource) may be called before a corresponding PipeElement.finalize(RelativeResource) must be called to free up a transfer slot.

        Returning a number less than or equal to zero indicates that an arbitrary number of resources may be transferred concurrently.

        Specified by:
        concurrency in class Tap
        Returns:
        The number of data resources this sink can receive concurrently.
